src:
Experiencia imperdible
02 Nov 2019 by Redacción Diario de Cuyo
"Un viaje a ciegas" es la primera obra musical y teatral que se centra en un bar de Buenos Aires de los años '40, donde los personajes van contando las diferentes historias de amor de sus vidas, a la espera de la llegada de una importante cantante; y donde la música y las historias hacen que el público pueda viajar por diferentes escenarios: Brasil y África, entre otros. Pero lo distinto de esta experiencia artística totalmente original -que tiene dirección de Martín Bondone- es que es de verdad "a ciegas", ya que la mayoría de los actores son ciegos y la sala está completamente a oscuras. De este modo, son los sentidos no visuales los que se convierten en protagonistas: los espectadores viajarán a través del olfato, los aromas y los estímulos táctiles. Creación del Centro Argentino de Teatro Ciego -que ya estuvo un par de veces por San Juan y con excelente convocatoria- la propuesta invita a percibir el mundo desde un lugar diferente, "una manera original de relajarse sin ser observado y largarse a la aventura de sentir cuando no se ve".

La cita es hoy a las 21 hs en Sala Z (Pedro Echagüe pasando Av. Alem). Las anticipadas cuestan $500 en boletería y $600 antes de la función.
text:
Draymond Greene Injured (VIDEO)
New torment for Golden State

02 Nov 2019


A disaster never comes alone, and in the case of Golden State, it brings all the mischief that one team can hit. There is no glue to Thompson since the end of last season, when Kevin Durant also suffered an Achilles tendon injury that he will not play all year, but now as a Brooklyn player, only three days ago he broke Stef Curry's arm and is now on the injured list and - Draymond Green!

One of the best all-round players today has injured the left index finger in the defeat of Golden State by San Antonio (110: 127) and his status for the match against Charlotte is questionable.
Greene appeared before the press with bandages on both wrists, with his left index finger immobilized. When asked what Green was about, he only answered that he had suffered a ligament, which would require a magnetic resonance examination. "I injured my finger, the ligaments are in question. That's right, it's ... I don't know if I'll play the next game, we'll see. Now it's a swollen finger. I haven’t been able to catch the ball nicely since the second quarter. Because of that, I made a lot of passes with my right hand and dribbled to the left. Hopefully things will improve quickly, "Green said.
Warriors coach Steve Kerr revealed that the exact date of Steph Curry's return is unknown, but that the recovery will not take too long. Draymond Greene eventually amassed six points, eight rebounds and seven assists in 34 minutes of play.


Check out a new episode of Mozzart's "Ekipizza"
